_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 17:07:28 using v2.0
title: How does the overall UK infant mortality rate compare to individual UK countries?
analysis_commentary:
The infant mortality rate (* see about this data) for the UK and each country in the UK has been steadily decreasing since 1960. The UK rate fell below 10 for the first time in 1984 and has decreased even further, to an all time low of 4.1 in 2012.

All countries have followed a similar trend, with Northern Ireland having the lowest rate of 3.5 in 2012; Scotland’s was 3.7, England’s and Wales’ were both 4.1.
data_source: Office of National Statistics, Annual data: Deaths (numbers and rates: total, infant, neonatal)
